intro: Mariscus recurvispicatus, commonly known as the curly-spined mariscus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant is native to certain regions of southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It has a compact growth habit and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
